title: train_network() -`FileNotFoundError: No such file: '....png'`
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

When running the function - `deeplabcut.train_network(path_config_file, shuffle=1, displayiters=100,saveiters=5000, maxiters=100000,allow_growth=True, max_snapshots_to_keep=5)` - the pose_cfg.yml file is loaded correctly, as well as, the training parameters and model. The iterations start smoothly, however at a certain random point, for no apparent reason the following error appears:

...

> iteration: 8600 loss: 0.0076 lr: 0.005
> iteration: 8700 loss: 0.0071 lr: 0.005
> iteration: 8800 loss: 0.0070 lr: 0.005
> iteration: 8900 loss: 0.0072 lr: 0.005
> Exception in thread Thread-3:
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\threading.py", line 932, in _bootstrap_inner
>     self.run()
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\threading.py", line 870, in run
>     self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\core\train.py", line 81, in load_and_enqueue
>     batch_np = dataset.next_batch()
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\datasets\pose_imgaug.py", line 370, in next_batch
>     ) = self.get_batch()
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\datasets\pose_imgaug.py", line 303, in get_batch
>     image = imread(
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\auxfun_videos.py", line 359, in imread
>     image = io.imread(image_path)
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\skimage\io\_io.py", line 48, in imread
>     img = call_plugin('imread', fname, plugin=plugin, **plugin_args)
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\skimage\io\manage_plugins.py", line 207, in call_plugin
>     return func(*args, **kwargs)
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\skimage\io\_plugins\imageio_plugin.py", line 10, in imread
>     return np.asarray(imageio_imread(*args, **kwargs))
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\imageio\__init__.py", line 86, in imread
>     return imread_v2(uri, format=format, **kwargs)
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\imageio\v2.py", line 159, in imread
>     with imopen(uri, "ri", plugin=format) as file:
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\imageio\core\imopen.py", line 162, in imopen
>     request = Request(uri, io_mode, format_hint=format_hint)
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\imageio\core\request.py", line 248, in __init__
>     self._parse_uri(uri)
>   File "D:\_users\Duarte\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\imageio\core\request.py", line 388, in _parse_uri
>     raise FileNotFoundError("No such file: '%s'" % fn)
> FileNotFoundError: No such file: '\\files0\data\duteixei\My Documents\Duarte\3rd_withDS-Duarte-2022-03-11\labeled-data\HC_7_L_syncdownsampled\img2044.png'

### Operating System

Edition	Windows 10 Education
Version	21H2
Installed on	‎01-‎Mar-‎22
OS build	19044.1586
Experience	Windows Feature Experience Pack 120.2212.4170.0

### DeepLabCut version

'2.2.0.6'

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2060

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Use the GUI to create a new project with a video previously downsampled and ready to go
2. Label the frames and create the training set
3. Use a .ipynb to initalize the variables with the correct paths created 
4. And then run the above mentioned line - `deeplabcut.train_network(path_config_file, shuffle=1, displayiters=100,saveiters=5000, maxiters=100000,allow_growth=True, max_snapshots_to_keep=5)`

The error must appear after a few minutes of training
The notebook cell does not stop running and, after the error, if I stop it, the kernel of the notebook has to be restarted.

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Anything else?

The files with the information regarding the coordinates of the labeled images and the images themselves are in the correct directory.
I am using the conda installation, with VS code.
The image that it says is missing is not always the same. The iteration it breaks is not always the same. I could never get past the 18000 iteration, but I was aiming for 100000's.

Thank you for all the help you can give me.

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
